service.name: Amazon CloudFormation
service.documentation: AWS CloudFormation gives developers and systems administrators an easy way to create and manage a collection of related AWS resources, provisioning and updating them in an orderly and predictable fashion. You can use AWS CloudFormation’s sample templates or create your own templates to describe the AWS resources, and any associated dependencies or runtime parameters, required to run your application. You don’t need to figure out the order for provisioning AWS services or the subtleties of making those dependencies work. CloudFormation takes care of this for you. After the AWS resources are deployed, you can modify and update them in a controlled and predictable way, in effect applying version control to your AWS infrastructure the same way you do with your software.

cabal.name: Amazon CloudFormation
cabal.description: AWS CloudFormation gives developers and systems administrators an easy way to create and manage a collection of related AWS resources, provisioning and updating them in an orderly and predictable fashion. You can use AWS CloudFormation’s sample templates or create your own templates to describe the AWS resources, and any associated dependencies or runtime parameters, required to run your application. You don’t need to figure out the order for provisioning AWS services or the subtleties of making those dependencies work. CloudFormation takes care of this for you. After the AWS resources are deployed, you can modify and update them in a controlled and predictable way, in effect applying version control to your AWS infrastructure the same way you do with your software.

You can use AWS CloudFormation’s sample templates or create your own templates to describe the AWS resources, and any associated dependencies or runtime parameters, required to run your application. You don’t need to figure out the order for provisioning AWS services or the subtleties of making those dependencies work. CloudFormation takes care of this for you. After the AWS resources are deployed, you can modify and update them in a controlled and predictable way, in effect applying version control to your AWS infrastructure the same way you do with your software.

optional.name: _tagKey
optional.documentation: Required. A string used to identify this tag. You can specify a maximum of 128 characters for a tag key. Tags owned by Amazon Web Services (AWS) have the reserved prefix: aws:.

optional.name: _tagValue
optional.documentation: Required. A string containing the value for this tag. You can specify a maximum of 256 characters for a tag value.

operations.name: CancelUpdateStack
operations.documentation: Cancels an update on the specified stack. If the call completes successfully, the stack will roll back the update and revert to the previous stack configuration.

operations.name: CreateStack
operations.documentation: Creates a stack as specified in the template. After the call completes successfully, the stack creation starts. You can check the status of the stack via the DescribeStacks API.

required.name: _csiStackName
required.documentation: The name associated with the stack. The name must be unique within your AWS account.

optional.name: _csiTemplateBody
optional.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _csiTemplateURL
optional.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size: 307,200 bytes) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to the Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _csiParameters
optional.documentation: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack.

optional.name: _csiDisableRollback
optional.documentation:
Set to true to disable rollback of the stack if stack creation failed. You can specify either DisableRollback or OnFailure, but not both.

Default: false

optional.name: _csiTimeoutInMinutes
optional.documentation: The amount of time that can pass before the stack status becomes CREATE_FAILED; if DisableRollback is not set or is set to false, the stack will be rolled back.

optional.name: _csiNotificationARNs
optional.documentation: The Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic ARNs to publish stack related events. You can find your SNS topic ARNs using the SNS console or your Command Line Interface (CLI).

optional.name: _csiCapabilities
optional.documentation: The list of capabilities that you want to allow in the stack. If your template contains certain resources, you must specify the CAPABILITY_IAM value for this parameter; otherwise, this action returns an InsufficientCapabilities error. The following resources require you to specify the capabilities parameter: AWS::CloudFormation::Stack, AWS::IAM::AccessKey, AWS::IAM::Group, AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile, AWS::IAM::Policy, AWS::IAM::Role, AWS::IAM::User, and AWS::IAM::UserToGroupAddition.

optional.name: _csiOnFailure
optional.documentation:
Determines what action will be taken if stack creation fails. This must be one of: DO_NOTHING, ROLLBACK, or DELETE. You can specify either OnFailure or DisableRollback, but not both.

Default: ROLLBACK

optional.name: _csiStackPolicyBody
optional.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _csiStackPolicyURL
optional.documentation: Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _csiTags
optional.documentation: A set of user-defined Tags to associate with this stack, represented by key/value pairs. Tags defined for the stack are propagated to EC2 resources that are created as part of the stack. A maximum number of 10 tags can be specified.

fields.name: _csiCapabilities
fields.documentation: The list of capabilities that you want to allow in the stack. If your template contains certain resources, you must specify the CAPABILITY_IAM value for this parameter; otherwise, this action returns an InsufficientCapabilities error. The following resources require you to specify the capabilities parameter: AWS::CloudFormation::Stack, AWS::IAM::AccessKey, AWS::IAM::Group, AWS::IAM::InstanceProfile, AWS::IAM::Policy, AWS::IAM::Role, AWS::IAM::User, and AWS::IAM::UserToGroupAddition.

fields.name: _csiDisableRollback
fields.documentation:
Set to true to disable rollback of the stack if stack creation failed. You can specify either DisableRollback or OnFailure, but not both.

Default: false

fields.name: _csiNotificationARNs
fields.documentation: The Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic ARNs to publish stack related events. You can find your SNS topic ARNs using the SNS console or your Command Line Interface (CLI).

fields.name: _csiOnFailure
fields.documentation:
Determines what action will be taken if stack creation fails. This must be one of: DO_NOTHING, ROLLBACK, or DELETE. You can specify either OnFailure or DisableRollback, but not both.

Default: ROLLBACK

fields.name: _csiParameters
fields.documentation: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack.

fields.name: _csiStackName
fields.documentation: The name associated with the stack. The name must be unique within your AWS account.

fields.name: _csiStackPolicyBody
fields.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _csiStackPolicyURL
fields.documentation: Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _csiTags
fields.documentation: A set of user-defined Tags to associate with this stack, represented by key/value pairs. Tags defined for the stack are propagated to EC2 resources that are created as part of the stack. A maximum number of 10 tags can be specified.

fields.name: _csiTemplateBody
fields.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _csiTemplateURL
fields.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size: 307,200 bytes) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to the Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _csiTimeoutInMinutes
fields.documentation: The amount of time that can pass before the stack status becomes CREATE_FAILED; if DisableRollback is not set or is set to false, the stack will be rolled back.

operations.name: DeleteStack
operations.documentation: Deletes a specified stack. Once the call completes successfully, stack deletion starts. Deleted stacks do not show up in the DescribeStacks API if the deletion has been completed successfully.

field.name: _dsi1StackName
field.documentation: The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack.

required.documentation: The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack.

fields.name: _dsi1StackName
fields.documentation: The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack.

optional.name: _dseoStackEvents
optional.documentation: A list of StackEvents structures.

optional.name: _dseoNextToken
optional.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of events, if there is one.

fields.name: _dseoNextToken
fields.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of events, if there is one.

fields.name: _dseoStackEvents
fields.documentation: A list of StackEvents structures.

operations.name: DescribeStackEvents
operations.documentation: Returns all stack related events for a specified stack. For more information about a stack's event history, go to Stacks in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

optional.name: _dseiStackName
optional.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _dseiNextToken
optional.documentation:
String that identifies the start of the next list of events, if there is one.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dseiNextToken
fields.documentation:
String that identifies the start of the next list of events, if there is one.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dseiStackName
fields.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

field.name: _dsroStackResourceDetail
field.documentation: A StackResourceDetail structure containing the description of the specified resource in the specified stack.

optional.name: _dsroStackResourceDetail
optional.documentation: A StackResourceDetail structure containing the description of the specified resource in the specified stack.

fields.name: _dsroStackResourceDetail
fields.documentation: A StackResourceDetail structure containing the description of the specified resource in the specified stack.

operations.name: DescribeStackResource
operations.documentation:
Returns a description of the specified resource in the specified stack.

For deleted stacks, DescribeStackResource returns resource information for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.

required.name: _dsri1StackName
required.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

required.name: _dsri1LogicalResourceId
required.documentation:
The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dsri1LogicalResourceId
fields.documentation:
The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dsri1StackName
fields.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _dsroStackResources
optional.documentation: A list of StackResource structures.

fields.name: _dsroStackResources
fields.documentation: A list of StackResource structures.

operations.name: DescribeStackResources
operations.documentation:
Returns AWS resource descriptions for running and deleted stacks. If StackName is specified, all the associated resources that are part of the stack are returned. If PhysicalResourceId is specified, the associated resources of the stack that the resource belongs to are returned.

For deleted stacks, DescribeStackResources returns resource information for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.

You must specify either StackName or PhysicalResourceId, but not both. In addition, you can specify LogicalResourceId to filter the returned result. For more information about resources, the LogicalResourceId and PhysicalResourceId, go to the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

optional.name: _dsriStackName
optional.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

Required: Conditional. If you do not specify StackName, you must specify PhysicalResourceId.

optional.name: _dsriLogicalResourceId
optional.documentation:
The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _dsriPhysicalResourceId
optional.documentation:
The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource supported by AWS CloudFormation.

For example, for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance, PhysicalResourceId corresponds to the InstanceId. You can pass the EC2 InstanceId to DescribeStackResources to find which stack the instance belongs to and what other resources are part of the stack.

Required: Conditional. If you do not specify PhysicalResourceId, you must specify StackName.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dsriLogicalResourceId
fields.documentation:
The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dsriPhysicalResourceId
fields.documentation:
The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource supported by AWS CloudFormation.

For example, for an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance, PhysicalResourceId corresponds to the InstanceId. You can pass the EC2 InstanceId to DescribeStackResources to find which stack the instance belongs to and what other resources are part of the stack.

Required: Conditional. If you do not specify PhysicalResourceId, you must specify StackName.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _dsriStackName
fields.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

Required: Conditional. If you do not specify StackName, you must specify PhysicalResourceId.

optional.name: _dsoStacks
optional.documentation: A list of stack structures.

optional.name: _dsoNextToken
optional.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

fields.name: _dsoNextToken
fields.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

fields.name: _dsoStacks
fields.documentation: A list of stack structures.

operations.name: DescribeStacks
operations.documentation: Returns the description for the specified stack; if no stack name was specified, then it returns the description for all the stacks created.

optional.name: _dsiStackName
optional.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _dsiNextToken
optional.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

fields.name: _dsiNextToken
fields.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

fields.name: _dsiStackName
fields.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

field.name: _etcoUrl
field.documentation: An AWS Simple Monthly Calculator URL with a query string that describes the resources required to run the template.

optional.name: _etcoUrl
optional.documentation: An AWS Simple Monthly Calculator URL with a query string that describes the resources required to run the template.

fields.name: _etcoUrl
fields.documentation: An AWS Simple Monthly Calculator URL with a query string that describes the resources required to run the template.

operations.name: EstimateTemplateCost
operations.documentation: Returns the estimated monthly cost of a template. The return value is an AWS Simple Monthly Calculator URL with a query string that describes the resources required to run the template.

optional.name: _etciTemplateBody
optional.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

Conditional: You must pass TemplateBody or TemplateURL. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

optional.name: _etciTemplateURL
optional.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must pass TemplateURL or TemplateBody. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

optional.name: _etciParameters
optional.documentation: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters.

fields.name: _etciParameters
fields.documentation: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters.

fields.name: _etciTemplateBody
fields.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

Conditional: You must pass TemplateBody or TemplateURL. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

fields.name: _etciTemplateURL
fields.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must pass TemplateURL or TemplateBody. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

field.name: _gspoStackPolicyBody
field.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. (For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

optional.name: _gspoStackPolicyBody
optional.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. (For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

fields.name: _gspoStackPolicyBody
fields.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. (For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

operations.name: GetStackPolicy
operations.documentation: Returns the stack policy for a specified stack. If a stack doesn't have a policy, a null value is returned.

field.name: _gspiStackName
field.documentation: The name or stack ID that is associated with the stack whose policy you want to get.

required.name: _gspiStackName
required.documentation: The name or stack ID that is associated with the stack whose policy you want to get.

fields.name: _gspiStackName
fields.documentation: The name or stack ID that is associated with the stack whose policy you want to get.

field.name: _gtoTemplateBody
field.documentation: Structure containing the template body. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

optional.name: _gtoTemplateBody
optional.documentation: Structure containing the template body. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

fields.name: _gtoTemplateBody
fields.documentation: Structure containing the template body. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

operations.name: GetTemplate
operations.documentation:
Returns the template body for a specified stack. You can get the template for running or deleted stacks.

For deleted stacks, GetTemplate returns the template for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.

field.name: _gtiStackName
field.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

required.name: _gtiStackName
required.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _gtiStackName
fields.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _lsroStackResourceSummaries
optional.documentation: A list of StackResourceSummary structures.

optional.name: _lsroNextToken
optional.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stack resources, if there is one.

fields.name: _lsroNextToken
fields.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stack resources, if there is one.

fields.name: _lsroStackResourceSummaries
fields.documentation: A list of StackResourceSummary structures.

operations.name: ListStackResources
operations.documentation:
Returns descriptions of all resources of the specified stack.

For deleted stacks, ListStackResources returns resource information for up to 90 days after the stack has been deleted.

required.name: _lsriStackName
required.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _lsriNextToken
optional.documentation:
String that identifies the start of the next list of stack resource summaries, if there is one.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _lsriNextToken
fields.documentation:
String that identifies the start of the next list of stack resource summaries, if there is one.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _lsriStackName
fields.documentation:
The name or the unique identifier associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

  • Running stacks: You can specify either the stack's name or its unique stack ID.
  • Deleted stacks: You must specify the unique stack ID.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _lsoStackSummaries
optional.documentation: A list of StackSummary structures containing information about the specified stacks.

optional.name: _lsoNextToken
optional.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

fields.name: _lsoNextToken
fields.documentation: String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

fields.name: _lsoStackSummaries
fields.documentation: A list of StackSummary structures containing information about the specified stacks.

operations.name: ListStacks
operations.documentation: Returns the summary information for stacks whose status matches the specified StackStatusFilter. Summary information for stacks that have been deleted is kept for 90 days after the stack is deleted. If no StackStatusFilter is specified, summary information for all stacks is returned (including existing stacks and stacks that have been deleted).

optional.name: _lsiNextToken
optional.documentation:
String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

Default: There is no default value.

optional.name: _lsiStackStatusFilter
optional.documentation: Stack status to use as a filter. Specify one or more stack status codes to list only stacks with the specified status codes. For a complete list of stack status codes, see the StackStatus parameter of the Stack data type.

fields.name: _lsiNextToken
fields.documentation:
String that identifies the start of the next list of stacks, if there is one.

Default: There is no default value.

fields.name: _lsiStackStatusFilter
fields.documentation: Stack status to use as a filter. Specify one or more stack status codes to list only stacks with the specified status codes. For a complete list of stack status codes, see the StackStatus parameter of the Stack data type.

operations.name: SetStackPolicy
operations.documentation: Sets a stack policy for a specified stack.

required.name: _sspiStackName
required.documentation: The name or stack ID that you want to associate a policy with.

optional.name: _sspiStackPolicyBody
optional.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _sspiStackPolicyURL
optional.documentation: Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _sspiStackName
fields.documentation: The name or stack ID that you want to associate a policy with.

fields.name: _sspiStackPolicyBody
fields.documentation: Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go to Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _sspiStackPolicyURL
fields.documentation: Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _usoStackId
optional.documentation: Unique identifier of the stack.

fields.name: _usoStackId
fields.documentation: Unique identifier of the stack.

operations.name: UpdateStack
operations.documentation:
Updates a stack as specified in the template. After the call completes successfully, the stack update starts. You can check the status of the stack via the DescribeStacks action.

To get a copy of the template for an existing stack, you can use the GetTemplate action.

Tags that were associated with this stack during creation time will still be associated with the stack after an UpdateStack operation.

For more information about creating an update template, updating a stack, and monitoring the progress of the update, see Updating a Stack.

required.name: _usiStackName
required.documentation: The name or stack ID of the stack to update.

optional.name: _usiTemplateBody
optional.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _usiTemplateURL
optional.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

optional.name: _usiUsePreviousTemplate
optional.documentation: Reuse the existing template that is associated with the stack that you are updating.

optional.name: _usiStackPolicyDuringUpdateBody
optional.documentation:
Structure containing the temporary overriding stack policy body. You can specify either the StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody or the StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL parameter, but not both.

If you want to update protected resources, specify a temporary overriding stack policy during this update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack will be used.

optional.name: _usiStackPolicyDuringUpdateURL
optional.documentation:
Location of a file containing the temporary overriding stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody or the StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL parameter, but not both.

If you want to update protected resources, specify a temporary overriding stack policy during this update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack will be used.

optional.name: _usiParameters
optional.documentation: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack.

optional.name: _usiCapabilities
optional.documentation: The list of capabilities that you want to allow in the stack. If your stack contains IAM resources, you must specify the CAPABILITY_IAM value for this parameter; otherwise, this action returns an InsufficientCapabilities error. IAM resources are the following: AWS::IAM::AccessKey, AWS::IAM::Group, AWS::IAM::Policy, AWS::IAM::User, and AWS::IAM::UserToGroupAddition.

optional.name: _usiStackPolicyBody
optional.documentation:
Structure containing a new stack policy body. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

You might update the stack policy, for example, in order to protect a new resource that you created during a stack update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack is unchanged.

optional.name: _usiStackPolicyURL
optional.documentation:
Location of a file containing the updated stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

You might update the stack policy, for example, in order to protect a new resource that you created during a stack update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack is unchanged.

optional.name: _usiNotificationARNs
optional.documentation: Update the ARNs for the Amazon SNS topics that are associated with the stack.

fields.name: _usiCapabilities
fields.documentation: The list of capabilities that you want to allow in the stack. If your stack contains IAM resources, you must specify the CAPABILITY_IAM value for this parameter; otherwise, this action returns an InsufficientCapabilities error. IAM resources are the following: AWS::IAM::AccessKey, AWS::IAM::Group, AWS::IAM::Policy, AWS::IAM::User, and AWS::IAM::UserToGroupAddition.

fields.name: _usiNotificationARNs
fields.documentation: Update the ARNs for the Amazon SNS topics that are associated with the stack.

fields.name: _usiParameters
fields.documentation: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack.

fields.name: _usiStackName
fields.documentation: The name or stack ID of the stack to update.

fields.name: _usiStackPolicyBody
fields.documentation:
Structure containing a new stack policy body. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

You might update the stack policy, for example, in order to protect a new resource that you created during a stack update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack is unchanged.

fields.name: _usiStackPolicyDuringUpdateBody
fields.documentation:
Structure containing the temporary overriding stack policy body. You can specify either the StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody or the StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL parameter, but not both.

If you want to update protected resources, specify a temporary overriding stack policy during this update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack will be used.

fields.name: _usiStackPolicyDuringUpdateURL
fields.documentation:
Location of a file containing the temporary overriding stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody or the StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL parameter, but not both.

If you want to update protected resources, specify a temporary overriding stack policy during this update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack will be used.

fields.name: _usiStackPolicyURL
fields.documentation:
Location of a file containing the updated stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

You might update the stack policy, for example, in order to protect a new resource that you created during a stack update. If you do not specify a stack policy, the current policy that is associated with the stack is unchanged.

fields.name: _usiTemplateBody
fields.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _usiTemplateURL
fields.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must specify either the TemplateBody or the TemplateURL parameter, but not both.

fields.name: _usiUsePreviousTemplate
fields.documentation: Reuse the existing template that is associated with the stack that you are updating.

optional.name: _vtoParameters
optional.documentation: A list of TemplateParameter structures.

optional.name: _vtoDescription
optional.documentation: The description found within the template.

optional.name: _vtoCapabilities
optional.documentation: The capabilities found within the template. Currently, CAPABILITY_IAM is the only capability detected. If your template contains IAM resources, you must specify the CAPABILITY_IAM value for this parameter when you use the CreateStack or UpdateStack actions with your template; otherwise, those actions return an InsufficientCapabilities error.

optional.name: _vtoCapabilitiesReason
optional.documentation: The capabilities reason found within the template.

fields.name: _vtoCapabilities
fields.documentation: The capabilities found within the template. Currently, CAPABILITY_IAM is the only capability detected. If your template contains IAM resources, you must specify the CAPABILITY_IAM value for this parameter when you use the CreateStack or UpdateStack actions with your template; otherwise, those actions return an InsufficientCapabilities error.

fields.name: _vtoCapabilitiesReason
fields.documentation: The capabilities reason found within the template.

fields.name: _vtoDescription
fields.documentation: The description found within the template.

fields.name: _vtoParameters
fields.documentation: A list of TemplateParameter structures.

optional.name: _vtiTemplateBody
optional.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must pass TemplateURL or TemplateBody. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

optional.name: _vtiTemplateURL
optional.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size: 307,200 bytes) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must pass TemplateURL or TemplateBody. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

fields.name: _vtiTemplateBody
fields.documentation:
Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must pass TemplateURL or TemplateBody. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.

fields.name: _vtiTemplateURL
fields.documentation:
Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size: 307,200 bytes) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

Conditional: You must pass TemplateURL or TemplateBody. If both are passed, only TemplateBody is used.
